stack wrote:
> jblowe77 wrote:


>>- Would like to test to see whether any of a certain small list of
>>words occurs on a page before actually saving it.
> 
> 
> There is no out-of-the-box facility to help you do this.  You'll have to 
> write your own processor to parse out text to run your word-check against.

If you wind up taking this step, you could think of your content-sensitive
processor(s) as either a "classifier" or a "mid-processing extra scope
enforcer". It could mark URLs that are not of interest with an error code
that prevents further link-extraction or writing-to-disk (depending on where
in the URL-processing you insert your extra Processor). For example,
your processor might do the following to a CrawlURI determined to be of
no interest:

	curi.setFetchStatus(FetchStatusCodes.S_OUT_OF_SCOPE);

...meaning even though the URL was scheduled and/or partially processed, a
later check determined it was not of interest.

- Gordon @ IA
